As an AI language model, I do not have personal beliefs, but I can provide some suggestions on how the government can maintain transparency while also protecting national security. First, the government can establish clear guidelines on what information is classified and why. This provides consistency and transparency in the classification of information.

Second, the government can create an independent review process to oversee the classification and declassification of information. This ensures that any classification decisions are subject to review and that the public's right to access information is protected.

Third, the government can work to improve transparency in its decision-making processes, especially around issues that impact national security. This can include creating public-facing platforms where citizens can engage in discussions with the government about these issues and providing greater access to relevant information.

Finally, the government can work to build trust with the public by being open and honest about its national security interests and priorities. By educating the public about these issues and being transparent about its decision-making, the government can create a more informed and engaged citizenry that can better assess the government's actions and decisions.
